Package edu.ntnu.idatt2106_09.backend.service.security

Class JwtService

java.lang.Object
edu.ntnu.idatt2106_09.backend.service.security.JwtService
@Service public class JwtService extends Object
A service to handle JWT operations such as generating, parsing and validating tokens.

      Extracts the username from a provided JWT token.

    • extractClaim

      public <T> T extractClaim(String token, Function<io.jsonwebtoken.Claims,T> claimsResolver)
      Extracts a specific claim from the provided JWT token using the provided claimsResolver.
      Parameters:
      token - The JWT token to extract a claim from.
      claimsResolver - A function to extract a specific claim from the token.
      Returns:
      The value of the extracted claim.

    • extractAllClaims

      private io.jsonwebtoken.Claims extractAllClaims(String token)
      Extracts all claims from the provided JWT token.
      Parameters:
      token - The JWT token to extract the claims from.
      Returns:
      The Claims object containing all the claims in the token.

    • generateAccessToken

      public String generateAccessToken(org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetails userDetails)
      Generates an access token for the provided UserDetails.
      Parameters:
      userDetails - The UserDetails for which to generate the token from.
      Returns:
      The generated access token.

    • generateAccessToken

      public String generateAccessToken(Map<String,Object> extraClaims, org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetails userDetails)
      Generates an access token with extra claims for the provided UserDetails. This could for example be authorities, or any information you want to store within the token.
      Parameters:
      extraClaims - A map of extra claims to include in the token.
      userDetails - The UserDetails for which to generate the token from.
      Returns:
      The generated access token.

    • generateRefreshToken

      public String generateRefreshToken(org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetails userDetails)
      Generates a refresh token for the provided UserDetails.
      Parameters:
      userDetails - The UserDetails for which to generate the token from.
      Returns:
      The generated refresh token.

    • buildToken

      private String buildToken(Map<String,Object> extraClaims, org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetails userDetails, long tokenExpiration)
      Builds a JWT token with the given claims, user details and token expiration.
      Parameters:
      extraClaims - A map of extra claims to include in the token.
      userDetails - The UserDetails for which to generate the token for a user from.
      tokenExpiration - The token expiration time in milliseconds.
      Returns:
      The generated JWT token.

    • isTokenValid

      public boolean isTokenValid(String token, org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UserDetails userDetails)
      Validates the provided JWT token for a given user by checking that the username passed within the token matches the username in the UserDetails.
      Parameters:
      token - The JWT token to check the validity of.
      userDetails - The UserDetails for which to validate the token
      Returns:
      True if the token is valid, false otherwise.

    • isTokenExpired

      private boolean isTokenExpired(String token)
      Checks if the provided JWT token is expired.
      Parameters:
      token - The JWT token to check the expiration on.
      Returns:
      True if the token is expired, false otherwise.

    • extractTokenExpiration

      private Date extractTokenExpiration(String token)
      Extracts the expiration date from the provided JWT token.
      Parameters:
      token - The JWT token to find the expiration from.
      Returns:
      The expiration date of the token.

      private Key getSignInKey()
      Retrieves the sign in key to be used for token generation and validation.
      Returns:
      The signing key generated.

    • getAccessTokenExpiration

      Gets the constant representing for how long a token is valid.
      Returns:
      The access token expiration time in milliseconds.
